current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To require a study on the Russian RD–180 rocket engine.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: National Security Rocket Engine Study Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Report on
		Russian RD–180 rocket engine

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit to the congressional defense
		committees a report on the Russian RD–180 rocket engine.

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment
		of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Security Rocket Engine Study Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
An
		assessment of the feasibility of manufacturing an alternative rocket engine in the United
		States.

An
		estimate of the cost of manufacturing an alternative rocket engine in the United States,
		including any cost savings that manufacturing a domestic alternative provides compared to the cost of buying
		Russian engines over the life of the Evolved Expendable Launch Vehicle program.

A
		description of policy benefits and policy concerns related to where the rocket
		engine is manufactured.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall review the report
		submitted under

and submit the results of its study to the
		congressional defense committees.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Security Rocket Engine Study Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a
